titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ryck Hendrikse deed 1978.112
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:09:27 +0000.

did.abstract: Framed deed for land in Flatbush from Ryck Hendrikse to Jacob Hendrikse, dating from 1704 or 1705. Ryck Hendrikse was the son of Reycke and Ida Hendrikse, who emigrated to Kings County in 1663 from the Netherlands, settling in Flatbush.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Ryck Hendrikse deed, 1978.112, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ryck Hendrikse was the son of Reycke and Ida Hendrikse, who emigrated to Kings County in 1663 from the Netherlands, settling in Flatbush.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Framed deed for land in Flatbush from Ryck Hendrikse to Jacob Hendrikse, dating from 1704 or 1705.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Alma Uhlitz, 1974. Formally accessioned in 1978.
